description: Demolition of an existing house and the erection of two storey building comprising of two bedroom house with associated car parking, recyclable waste and cycle space.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (0401-PLA-00-101-Plan_Site.dwg [received 24/06/2020], 0401-PLA-00-201-Sections_A-A_B-B.dwg and 0401-PLA-00-201-Plan_Ground_Floor.dwg [received 12/06/2020], Detailed Flood Risk Assessment (HNL 171175 CB) and Energy Consumption Calculations [received 01/06/2020], Energy Statement [received 04/05/2020], Flood Risk Assessment (and follow-up) [received 18/02/2020 and 21/04/2020], Materials/Energy Statement [received 28/01/2020],  0401-PLA-00-700-Plan_Sewage.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-100-Plan_General, 0401-PLA-00-020-Existing_ Plan.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-021-Existing_Elevations.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-121-Plan_First_Floor.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-140-Plan_Roof.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-301-Elevations_North-South.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-302-Elevations_East-West.dwg, 0401-PLA-00-600-Visual.dwg and Indicative Materials Palette [received 23/01/2020]) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates) under the Standard Assessment Procedure shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions including the system details and MCS commissioning certificates/ DNO approvals etc. for the solar PV system.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the building, evidence shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the required sustainable materials standards: (i) At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification. (ii) At least 50% of timber and timber products are sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) schemes (iii) No construction or insulation materials have been used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected. The boundary treatment shall be completed before (the use hereby permitted is commenced) or (before the building(s) is/are occupied) or (in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority). Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved, details of both hard and soft landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved. These details shall include (means of enclosure; any vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc). 
Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications [including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment]; schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme).

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved, the applicant shall have removed the existing redundant vehicular crossover to the front of the property and had the footway reinstated, with evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.

Condition : 13 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and thereafter retained as such.

Condition : 14 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for cycle storage facilities have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority; at least two cycle spaces need to be provided for the house to accord with London Plan standards. The spaces must be secure, sheltered, easily accessible, and conveniently located. The arrangements shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and thereafter retained as such. Further guidance on appropriate dimensions, layouts, and stands is available in the West London Cycle Parking Guidance.

Condition : 15 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side or rear walls of the dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
